results.title: Reaction: portrait of a society in crisis
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Normand Cloutier, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: People from various English-speaking groups in Montreal and other places in Quebec express their personal reactions to the October Crisis of 1970 when Quebec nationalism took a violent turn. A British diplomat had been kidnapped, a Quebec cabinet minister murdered. The troops were brought in as a safeguard. This film is a vigorous reflection of the discussions and analyses of the situation that went on wherever people gathered, voicing attitudes and fears, sympathies and concerns.
results.title_for_label: Reaction: portrait of a society in crisis
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robin Spry, Normand Cloutier, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Reaching out: a story about mainstreaming
results.creator_credit: John Cosgrove, Terry Dunn, Educational Media and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the difficulties and rewards of integrating the handicapped into regular classrooms. Shows Mary, a severely deaf child with limited speech capabilities and cerebral palsy, and how she copes with mainstreaming.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Cosgrove, Terry Dunn, Educational Media and Walt Disney Productions

results.title: Real inside
results.creator_credit: David Verrall, John Weldon, Derek Lamb, Douglas MacDonald and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Meet Buck Boom—dynamic, forceful and creative—and a candidate for the job of executive assistant at a staid corporation. There’s no doubt in Boom’s mind that he’s the person for the job, but the question is, can he convince Mr. Mudgin, the personnel manager? For, you see, Boom is a cartoon and Mudgin is not used to dealing with someone who is “different.” Skillfully crafted, using an innovative combination of live action and animation techniques, this hilarious short film probes stereotypes, prejudices and hiring practices.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Verrall, John Weldon, Derek Lamb, Douglas MacDonald and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Ready or not
results.creator_credit: Colin Budds, David Campbell, Michael Vaughan and Film Victoria
results.brief_description: Conflict arises when a small factory facing closure is taken over by a large corporation who use it as a test case for the introduction of modern computerised manufacturing equipment. Relations between workers, management and unions deteriorate rapidly until an accident in the factory brings differences to a head.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Budds, David Campbell, Michael Vaughan and Film Victoria

results.title: Ready for the hills
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description: A training film on the basic essentials of hillcraft including training beforehand, blisters and the need for boots, type of anorak; windproof or waterproof, keeping together, the correct pace; how to walk, ascent and descent; the need for a leader, contrasts in weather conditions, food for lunch; emergency rations, drinking water and other refreshments, litter, first aid kit, map and compass, staying at youth hostels.

results.title: Reach for the sky (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Lewis Gilbert, Daniel M. Angel and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: The acclaimed film biography of British World War II hero, Douglas Bader, who after losing both legs in an aeroplane crash, overcame insurmountable odds to become one of the most decorated and remarkable fighter aces in history. The film is based on the best-selling biography, “Douglas Bader”, written by Paul Brickhill. The film stars Kenneth More.

results.title: Razorback
results.creator_credit: Russell Mulcahy, Hal McElroy, UAA Films and Western
results.brief_description: Story of a female animal rights campaigner who vanishes in the outback. Her husband sets out to find her, coming up against a monstrous wild boar that’s terrorising the countryside. Stars Gregory Harrison and Arkie Whiteley with Bill Kerr, Chris Haywood and Judy Morris.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Russell Mulcahy, Hal McElroy, UAA Films and Western
results.description:
Pitched as ‘Jaws on trotters’, this creature feature rises above its B-grade premise of a killer pig thanks to American ex-pat screenwriter Everett De Roche’s script and Russel Mulcahy’s distinct, music video style.

When a movie opens with world-weary grandfather Jake (Bill Kerr) putting his grandson to bed only to have the pig burst into the house and drag the child off into the night, you know you’re in for a trip. With shades of the Lindy Chamberlain case, Jake goes to trial but is acquitted for the child’s death. In the community’s eyes, he remains suspicious. While he searches for the boar that gorged his grandson, American traveller Carl (Gregory Harrison) searches for his missing girlfriend, a wildlife reporter who’s met a grisly fate at both the hands of a man and tusks of the eponymous pig.

While the storyline may not be the most sophisticated, the film is lauded for its visual flare and uncanny environment. As The New York Times notes, “the landscapes… have a wonderfully bizarre, almost Dali-esque character. This is a place where the full moon never wanes…”

Likewise, the limitations imposed by the quality of the animatronic boar also inform the optic amazement. Though it cost $250,000 to make, Razorback doesn’t look that great, so Mulcahy treats the creature much like Spielberg does his great white – it’s rarely seen.

The Guardian’s Luke Buckmaster considers the limitation a boon. “The director took on the challenge with gusto, creating a berserk aesthetic infused with POV shots, busy backgrounds, images graded with extreme colour and shadows and mega close-ups of the creature’s tusks and mouth. Razorback is a work of gut-busting visual bravado.”

Not bad praise for the man who directed Bonnie Tyler’s ‘Total Eclipse of the Heart’.

Rusell Mulcahy also holds the honour of being the director of the first video clip to ever appear on MTV.

results.title: Rats in the Ranks
results.creator_credit: Bob Connolly, Robin Anderson, Arundel Productions, Film Australia and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at political manoeuvering during the Mayoral elections for the Leichardt Council. Incumbent Larry Hand, while popular with the voters is not so popular with the Council.

constellations_other.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_other.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Connolly, Robin Anderson, Arundel Productions, Film Australia and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.description: A behind-the-scenes look at political manoeuvering during the Mayoral elections for the Leichardt Council. Incumbent Larry Hand, while popular with the voters is not so popular with the Council. In the Mayoral elections, the Council not the citizens vote, so Hand and his opposition engage in a battle of political tactics including calling in favours, backstabbing and media leaks. Gripping real-life drama with a knuckle-biting climax.
description_for_label: A behind-the-scenes look at political manoeuvering during the Mayoral elections for the Leichardt Council. Incumbent Larry Hand, while popular with the voters is not so popular with the Council. In the Mayoral elections, the Council not the citizens vote, so Hand and his opposition engage in a battle of political tactics including calling in favours, backstabbing and media leaks. Gripping real-life drama with a knuckle-biting climax.
